class sgrcolor.Reset#

Bases: object

Reset Style or color.

Attributes:

  • ALL

  • FG (Also available as FG.RESET)

  • BG (Also available as BG.RESET)

ALL = '\x1b[0m'#
BG = '\x1b[49m'#
FG = '\x1b[39m'#
class sgrcolor.SGRColor(font: str | tuple[str] = '', fg: str = '', bg: str = '')#

Bases: object

Generate an object to format input string.

Usage:

>>> important = SGRColor(
        font=('bold', 'italic'),
        fg='yellow',
    )
>>> print(important('Something IMPORTANT.'))

Constructor method.

Parameters:

  • font (str|tuple[str]) – String or Tuple of the font to use, value MUST be same as the attributes in Font class.

  • fg (str) – String of the foreground color to use, value MUST be same as the attribute in FG class.

  • bg (str) – String of the background color to use, value MUST be same as the attribute in BG class.

Raises:

  • TypeError – When type of font is not str or tuple, or type of fg, bg is not str.

  • ValueError – When font, fg or bg do not existed.

__call__(text: str) → str#

Return colored text.

Parameters:

text (str) – The text to be colored.

Returns:

Colored text.

Return type:

str

Raises:

TypeError – When type of text is not str.
